unnormalised: Subsidy programs in India require careful evaluation. The impact on fiscal deficit, especially considering states like Kerala already grappling with debt, warrants scrutiny. Are these programs effectively reaching the intended beneficiaries, like farmers in Punjab? Perhaps a model similar to MNREGA needs adaptation. The cost-benefit ratio, considering the long-term sustainability of, say, fertilizer subsidies, demands transparency. Over-reliance can stifle innovation, similar to issues faced by some PSU banks. We must assess if schemes truly uplift communities or fuel dependency, especially before Onam when needs rise. R. Verma committee recommendations should be revisited.
